medi:segment.name: Beginning of message
medi:segment.medi:documentation: BGM, A segment by which the sender uniquely identifies the Infrastructure condition message by means of its name and number and when necessary its function.

medi:segment.name: Date/time/period
medi:segment.medi:documentation: DTM, A segment specifying general dates and, when relevant, times related to the whole message. The segment must be specified at least once to specify the message date as allocated by the sender.

medi:segment.name: Free text
medi:segment.medi:documentation: FTX, A segment with free text information, in coded or clear form, used when additional information is needed, which is relevant for all components described in the actual message but cannot be accommodated within other segments.

medi:segmentGroup.medi:documentation: Segment group 1: A group of segments for giving references and where necessary, their dates, relating to the whole message.

medi:segment.name: Reference
medi:segment.medi:documentation: RFF, A segment identifying a reference by its type and number.

medi:segment.name: Date/time/period
medi:segment.medi:documentation: DTM, A segment specifying the date/time related to the referenced information.

medi:segmentGroup.medi:documentation: Segment group 2: A group of segments identifying the parties with associated information relevant to the whole message.

medi:segment.name: Name and address
medi:segment.medi:documentation: NAD, A segment identifying names and addresses of the parties, in coded or clear form, and their functions relevant to the message. At least one occurrence of the segment is required. This will normally be the party responsible for the component(s) described. It is recommended that, if possible, only the coded form of the party ID should be specified.

medi:segmentGroup.medi:documentation: Segment group 3: A group of segments giving contact details of a specific person and/or department within the party identified.

medi:segment.name: Contact information
medi:segment.medi:documentation: CTA, A segment to identify a person and/or department, and their function, to whom communications should be directed.

medi:segment.name: Communication contact
medi:segment.medi:documentation:
COM, A segment to identify a communication type and number for the contact specified.
4.1.2 Detail section
Information to be provided in the Detail section:

medi:segmentGroup.medi:documentation: Segment group 4: A group of segments identifying the component being reported. This includes the party responsible for the component, the physical characteristics of the component, the reason for the downtime and the scheduled downtime of the component.

medi:segment.name: Place/location identification
medi:segment.medi:documentation: LOC, A segment to identify the location of the component being reported. It is recommended that, where possible, codes should be used to identify the component to facilitate automatic processing.

medi:segment.name: Date/time/period
medi:segment.medi:documentation: DTM, A segment to specify dates associated with the downtime, availability or occurrence of an event connected to the component.

medi:segment.name: Name and address
medi:segment.medi:documentation: NAD, A segment to identify parties and/or addresses related to the component, such as installation address.

medi:segment.name: Free text
medi:segment.medi:documentation: FTX, A segment with free text information, in coded or clear form, used when additional information on the downtime, availability or occurrence of an event connected to the component is needed but cannot be accommodated within other segments. In computer to computer exchanges such text will normally require the receiver to process this segment manually.

medi:segmentGroup.medi:documentation: Segment group 5: A group of segments providing characteristics and characteristic details of the component.

medi:segment.name: Characteristic/class id
medi:segment.medi:documentation: CCI, A segment to identify characteristic and/or the characteristic name and characteristic relevance for the component.

medi:segment.name: Characteristic value
medi:segment.medi:documentation: CAV, A segment to specify characteristic of the component, by value in either coded form or in free format.

medi:segmentGroup.medi:documentation: Segment group 6: A group of segments to provide quantity change or other relevant quantities for the specified component and, where relevant, related date and time information, for example indication of capacity within a given period.

medi:segment.name: Quantity
medi:segment.medi:documentation: QTY, A segment to specify quantities related to the component.

medi:segment.name: Date/time/period
medi:segment.medi:documentation: DTM, A segment indicating date or time details relating to the quantity, for example indication of capacity within a given period.

medi:segmentGroup.medi:documentation: Segment group 7: A group of segment specifying schedules related to the downtime, availability or occurrence of an event connected to the component.

medi:segment.name: Scheduling conditions
medi:segment.medi:documentation: SCC, A segment specifying the type and status of the schedule being given, and optionally defining a pattern to be established, such as estimated schedule for the downtime, availability or occurrence of an event connected to the component.

medi:segment.name: Date/time/period
medi:segment.medi:documentation: DTM, A segment indicating the date/time details relevant to the schedule details. This segment may be used to indicate date/time ranges.
